page.title: 14TREVOR SKEET M.P.
page.content: In his speech to the House of Commons on 8th March 1985, Mr Skeet M.P. for North Beds, while congratulating the nuclear industry on producing 18% of the U.K.'s electricity, called for "satisfactory policy for the disposal of nuclear waste". He says it is "unlikely that the repository will be at Elstow" but evenso "apart from natural radiation, radiation from the waste will be virtually nil and thus harmless". The risk of damage to the water supply will be avoided by engineering and geology. Mr. Skeet has in no way actively campaigned against nuclear dumping in the County.
